intro: Ipomoea polycephala, commonly known as the crown of thorns, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink, often with a deep, contrasting throat. The plant has a woody stem with spiny branches, and its leaves are opposite, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in warm climates. Ipomoea polycephala is also known for its ability to bloom throughout the year under suitable conditions.
